meanings.definition: To plant seeds again in (an area)
meanings.sent1: After the storm, the farmer reseeded the field to grow new crops.
meanings.sent2: The gardener reseeded the flower bed to ensure beautiful blooms.
meanings.sent3: The birds thought the freshly reseeded soil was a buffet just for them!
meanings.sent4: Her kindness reseeded hope in the hearts of those who had lost it.
meanings.sent5: The act of reseeding the meadow brought forth a vibrant tapestry of wildflowers.

meanings.definition: To sow seeds again in (a field)
meanings.sent1: The farmer reseeded the barren field to bring life back to the soil.
meanings.sent2: In autumn, it's important to reseed the field for a bountiful harvest next year.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel reseeded the freshly planted field with acorns.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter reseeded joy in the hearts of all who heard it.
meanings.sent5: The act of reseeding the field symbolized renewal and growth.

meanings.definition: To scatter seeds again in (a garden)
meanings.sent1: The gardener reseeded the vegetable patch to ensure a plentiful harvest.
meanings.sent2: After the heavy rain, she reseeded the garden to replace the washed-away seeds.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy reseeded the garden with his toy bones, thinking they would grow.
meanings.sent4: His words reseeded doubt in her mind, causing her to question everything.
meanings.sent5: The act of reseeding the garden brought forth a colorful array of flowers and herbs.
